<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:A_10_feet_high_ancient_bed_in_National_Museum_of_Bangladesh_collected_from_Lohagara,Narail.jpg"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="3000" data-file-width="4000" decoding="async" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/15/A_10_feet_high_ancient_bed_in_National_Museum_of_Bangladesh_collected_from_Lohagara%2CNarail.jpg/220px-A_10_feet_high_ancient_bed_in_National_Museum_of_Bangladesh_collected_from_Lohagara%2CNarail.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/15/A_10_feet_high_ancient_bed_in_National_Museum_of_Bangladesh_collected_from_Lohagara%2CNarail.jpg/330px-A_10_feet_high_ancient_bed_in_National_Museum_of_Bangladesh_collected_from_Lohagara%2CNarail.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/15/A_10_feet_high_ancient_bed_in_National_Museum_of_Bangladesh_collected_from_Lohagara%2CNarail.jpg/440px-A_10_feet_high_ancient_bed_in_National_Museum_of_Bangladesh_collected_from_Lohagara%2CNarail.jpg 2x" width="220"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:A_10_feet_high_ancient_bed_in_National_Museum_of_Bangladesh_collected_from_Lohagara,Narail.jpg" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Beds of <a href="/wiki/Zamindar" title="Zamindar">zamindars</a> kept at the <a href="/wiki/Bangladesh_National_Museum" title="Bangladesh National Museum">Bangladesh National Museum</a></div></div></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Varendra_Research_Museum" title="Varendra Research Museum">Varendra Research Museum</a> is the oldest museum in Bangladesh. It houses important collections from both the pre-Islamic and Islamic periods, including the sculptures of the Pala-Sena School of Art and the Indus Valley civilisation, and Sanskrit, Arabic, and Persian manuscripts and inscriptions. The Ahsan Manzil, the former residence of the Nawab of Dhaka, is a national museum housing collections from the British Raj. It was the site of the founding conference of the All India Muslim League and hosted many British Viceroys in Dhaka.
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Tajhat_Palace" title="Tajhat Palace">Tajhat Palace</a> Museum preserves artefacts of the rich cultural heritage of North Bengal, including Hindu-Buddhist sculptures and Islamic manuscripts. The <a href="/wiki/Mymensingh_Museum" title="Mymensingh Museum">Mymensingh Museum</a> houses the personal antique collections of Bengali aristocrats in central Bengal. The <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ethnological_Museum_of_Chittagong" title="Ethnological Museum of Chittagong">Ethnological Museum of Chittagong</a> showcases the lifestyle of various tribes in Bangladesh. The <a href="/wiki/Bangladesh_National_Museum" title="Bangladesh National Museum">Bangladesh National Museum</a> is located in <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ramna" title="Ramna">Ramna</a>, Dhaka and has a rich collection of antiquities. The <a href="/wiki/Liberation_War_Museum" title="Liberation War Museum">Liberation War Museum</a> documents the Bangladeshi struggle for independence and the 1971 genocide.
</p><p>In ancient times, manuscripts were written on palm leaves, tree barks, parchment vellum and terracotta plates and preserved at monasteries known as <i><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Vihara" title="Vihara">viharas</a></i>. The Hussain Shahi dynasty established royal libraries during the Bengal Sultanate. Libraries were established in each district of Bengal by the zamindar gentry during the Bengal Renaissance in the 19th century. The trend of establishing libraries continued until the beginning of World War II. In 1854, four major public libraries were opened, including the Bogra Woodburn Library, the Rangpur Public Library, the Jessore Institute Public Library and the Barisal Public Library.
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Northbrook_Hall" title="Northbrook Hall">Northbrook Hall Public Library</a> was established in Dhaka in 1882 in honour of <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Lord_Northbrook" title="Lord Northbrook">Lord Northbrook</a>, the Governor-General. Other libraries established in the British period included the Victoria Public Library, Natore (1901), the Sirajganj Public Library (1882), the <a href="/wiki/Rajshahi_Public_Library" title="Rajshahi Public Library">Rajshahi Public Library</a> (1884), the Comilla Birchandra Library (1885), the Shah Makhdum Institute Public Library, Rajshahi (1891), the Noakhali Town Hall Public Library (1896), the Prize Memorial Library, Sylhet (1897), the Chittagong Municipality Public Library (1904) and the Varendra Research Library (1910). The Great Bengal Library Association was formed in 1925.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-446"><a href="#cite_note-446">[446]</a></sup> The <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Central_Public_Library_(Dhaka)" title="Central Public Library (Dhaka)">Central Public Library of Dhaka</a> was established in 1959. The <a href="/wiki/National_Library_of_Bangladesh" title="National Library of Bangladesh">National Library of Bangladesh</a> was established in 1972. The <a href="/wiki/Bishwo_Shahitto_Kendro" title="Bishwo Shahitto Kendro">World Literature Centre</a>, founded by <a href="/wiki/Ramon_Magsaysay_Award" title="Ramon Magsaysay Award">Ramon Magsaysay Award</a> winner <a href="/wiki/Abdullah_Abu_Sayeed" title="Abdullah Abu Sayeed">Abdullah Abu Sayeed</a>, is noted for operating numerous <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mobile_library" title="Mobile library">mobile libraries</a> across Bangladesh and was awarded the UNESCO Jon, Amos Comenius Medal.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">See also</span></h2>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1011085734">.mw-parser-output .reflist{font-size:90%;margin-bottom:0.5em;list-style-type:decimal}.mw-parser-output .reflist .references{font-size:100%;margin-bottom:0;list-style-type:inherit}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-2{column-width:30em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-3{column-width:25em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns{margin-top:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns ol{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns li{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-alpha{list-style-type:upper-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-roman{list-style-type:upper-roman}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-alpha{list-style-type:lower-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-greek{list-style-type:lower-greek}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-roman{list-style-type:lower-roman}</style><div class="reflist reflist-columns references-column-width" style="column-width: 30em;">
<ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-national_march-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-national_march_1-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20161228040953/http://visitbangladesh.gov.bd/about-bangladesh/national-symbol/" rel="nofollow">"National Symbols→National march"</a>. <i>Bangladesh Tourism Board</i>. Bangladesh: Ministry of Civil Aviation &amp; Tourism. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://visitbangladesh.gov.bd/about-bangladesh/national-symbol/" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 28 December 2016<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">21 February</span> 2015</span>. <q>In 13 January 1972, the ministry of Bangladesh has adopted this song as a national marching song on its first meeting after the country's independence.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Bangladesh+Tourism+Board&amp;rft.atitle=National+Symbols%E2%86%92National+march&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fvisitbangladesh.gov.bd%2Fabout-bangladesh%2Fnational-symbol%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-27"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-27">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://memory.loc.gov/cgi-bin/query/r?frd/cstdy:@field%28DOCID+bd0014%29" rel="nofollow">"Bangladesh: early history, 1000 B.C.–A.D. 1202"</a>. <i>Bangladesh: A country study</i>. Washington, DC: <a href="/wiki/Library_of_Congress" title="Library of Congress">Library of Congress</a>. September 1988. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20131207010051/http://memory.loc.gov/cgi-bin/query/r?frd%2Fcstdy%3A%40field%28DOCID+bd0014%29" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 7 December 2013<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">1 December</span> 2014</span>. <q>Historians believe that Bengal, the area comprising present-day Bangladesh and the Indian state of <a href="/wiki/West_Bengal" title="West Bengal">West Bengal</a>, was settled in about 1000 B.C. by Dravidian-speaking peoples who were later known as the Bang. Their homeland bore various titles that reflected earlier tribal names, such as Vanga, Banga, Bangala, Bangal, and Bengal.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Bangladesh%3A+A+country+study&amp;rft.atitle=Bangladesh%3A+early+history%2C+1000+B.C.%E2%80%93A.D.+1202&amp;rft.date=1988-09&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fmemory.loc.gov%2Fcgi-bin%2Fquery%2Fr%3Ffrd%2Fcstdy%3A%40field%2528DOCID%2Bbd0014%2529&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-auto4-28"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-auto4_28-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-auto4_28-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFSenGupta2012">SenGupta, Amitabh (2012). <i>Scroll Paintings of Bengal: Art in the Village</i>. <li id="cite_note-29"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-29">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFKeay2000"><a href="/wiki/John_Keay" title="John Keay">Keay, John</a> (2000). <i>India: A History</i>. Atlantic Monthly Press. p. 220. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-87113-800-2" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-87113-800-2"><bdi>978-0-87113-800-2</bdi></a>. <q>In C1020 ... launched Rajendra's great northern escapade ... peoples he defeated have been tentatively identified ... 'Vangala-desa where the rain water never stopped' sounds like a fair description of Bengal in the monsoon.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=India%3A+A+History&amp;rft.pages=220&amp;rft.pub=Atlantic+Monthly+Press&amp;rft.date=2000&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-87113-800-2&amp;rft.aulast=Keay&amp;rft.aufirst=John&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-Ahmed2004-31"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Ahmed2004_31-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Ahmed2004_31-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFAhmed2004">Ahmed, Salahuddin (2004). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Szfqq7ruqWgC&amp;pg=PA23" rel="nofollow"><i>Bangladesh: Past and Present</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-32"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-32">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">"But the most important development of this period was that the country for the first time received a name, ie Bangalah." <a class="external text" href="http://en.banglapedia.org/index.php?title=Islam,_Bengal" rel="nofollow">Banglapedia: Islam, Bengal</a> <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20150723091245/http://en.banglapedia.org/index.php?title=Islam,_Bengal" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> 23 July 2015 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-33"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-33">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFSircar1971"><a href="/wiki/Dineshchandra_Sircar" title="Dineshchandra Sircar">Sircar, D.C.</a> (1971) [First published 1960]. <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=AqKw1Mn8WcwC" rel="nofollow"><i>Studies in the Geography of Ancient and Medieval India</i></a> (2nd ed.). <li id="cite_note-48"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-48">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFGhosh2019">Ghosh, Suchandra (2 September 2019). <a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1080/19480881.2019.1640577" rel="nofollow">"Crossings and contacts across the Bay of Bengal: a connected history of ports in early South and Southeast Asia"</a>. <i>Journal of the Indian Ocean Region</i>. <b>15</b> (3): 281–296. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1080%2F19480881.2019.1640577" rel="nofollow">10.1080/19480881.2019.1640577</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a> <a class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:202332142" rel="nofollow">202332142</a> – via Taylor and Francis+NEJM.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+the+Indian+Ocean+Region&amp;rft.atitle=Crossings+and+contacts+across+the+Bay+of+Bengal%3A+a+connected+history+of+ports+in+early+South+and+Southeast+Asia&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.pages=281-296&amp;rft.date=2019-09-02&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1080%2F19480881.2019.1640577&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A202332142%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft.aulast=Ghosh&amp;rft.aufirst=Suchandra&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.1080%2F19480881.2019.1640577&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-Eaton1996p64-64"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Eaton1996p64_64-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFRichard_M._Eaton1996">Richard M. Eaton (1996). <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/riseofislambenga00eato/page/64" rel="nofollow"><i>The Rise of Islam and the Bengal Frontier, 1204–1760</i></a>. University of California Press. pp. <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/riseofislambenga00eato/page/64" rel="nofollow">64–</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-520-20507-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-520-20507-9"><bdi>978-0-520-20507-9</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Rise+of+Islam+and+the+Bengal+Frontier%2C+1204%E2%80%931760&amp;rft.pages=64-&amp;rft.pub=University+of+California+Press&amp;rft.date=1996&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-520-20507-9&amp;rft.au=Richard+M.+Eaton&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Friseofislambenga00eato%2Fpage%2F64&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-65"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-65">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFRila_Mukherjee2011">Rila Mukherjee (2011). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=7xeqhnYtrKcC&amp;pg=PA34" rel="nofollow"><i>Pelagic Passageways: The Northern Bay of Bengal Before Colonialism</i></a>. Primus Books. pp. 34–. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-93-80607-20-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-93-80607-20-7"><bdi>978-93-80607-20-7</bdi></a>. <q>The <i>Sri Rajmala</i> indicates that the periodic invasions of Tripura by the Bengal sultans were part of the same strategy [to control the sub-Himalayan routes from the south-eastern delta]. Mines of coarse gold were found in Tripura.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Pelagic+Passageways%3A+The+Northern+Bay+of+Bengal+Before+Colonialism&amp;rft.pages=34-&amp;rft.pub=Primus+Books&amp;rft.date=2011&amp;rft.isbn=978-93-80607-20-7&amp;rft.au=Rila+Mukherjee&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D7xeqhnYtrKcC%26pg%3DPA34&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-66"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-66">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFPerween_Hasan2007">Perween Hasan (2007). <i>Sultans and Mosques: The Early Muslim Architecture of Bangladesh</i>. I.B.Tauris. p. 16. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-84511-381-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-84511-381-0"><bdi>978-1-84511-381-0</bdi></a>. <q>[Husayn Shah] reduced the kingdoms of ... Tripura in the east to vassalage.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Sultans+and+Mosques%3A+The+Early+Muslim+Architecture+of+Bangladesh&amp;rft.pages=16&amp;rft.pub=I.B.Tauris&amp;rft.date=2007&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-84511-381-0&amp;rft.au=Perween+Hasan&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Hasan2007p16-17-67"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Hasan2007p16-17_67-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFPerween_Hasan2007">Perween Hasan (2007). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Uunyz4qFZwEC&amp;pg=PA16" rel="nofollow"><i>Sultans and Mosques: The Early Muslim Architecture of Bangladesh</i></a>. I.B.Tauris. pp. 16–17. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-84511-381-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-84511-381-0"><bdi>978-1-84511-381-0</bdi></a>. <q>[Husayn Shah pushed] its western frontier past Bihar up to Saran in Jaunpur ... when Sultan Husayn Shah Sharqi of Jaunpur fled to Bengal after being defeated in battle by Sultan Sikandar Lodhi of Delhi, the latter attacked Bengal in pursuit of the Jaunpur ruler. Unable to make any gains, Sikandar Lodhi returned home after concluding a peace treaty with the Bengal sultan.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Sultans+and+Mosques%3A+The+Early+Muslim+Architecture+of+Bangladesh&amp;rft.pages=16-17&amp;rft.pub=I.B.Tauris&amp;rft.date=2007&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-84511-381-0&amp;rft.au=Perween+Hasan&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DUunyz4qFZwEC%26pg%3DPA16&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-68"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-68">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation cs1 cs1-prop-script cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source" id="CITEREFChoudhury1917"><a href="/wiki/Achyut_Charan_Choudhury" title="Achyut Charan Choudhury">Choudhury, Achyut Charan</a> (1917). <i><a class="extiw" href="https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/bn:%E0%A6%AA%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%A4%E0%A6%BE:%E0%A6%B6%E0%A7%8D%E0%A6%B0%E0%A7%80%E0%A6%B9%E0%A6%9F%E0%A7%8D%E0%A6%9F%E0%A7%87%E0%A6%B0_%E0%A6%87%E0%A6%A4%E0%A6%BF%E0%A6%AC%E0%A7%83%E0%A6%A4%E0%A7%8D%E0%A6%A4_-_%E0%A6%89%E0%A6%A4%E0%A7%8D%E0%A6%A4%E0%A6%B0%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%82%E0%A6%B6.pdf/%E0%A7%AA%E0%A7%AE%E0%A7%AA" title="s:bn:পাতা:শ্রীহট্টের ইতিবৃত্ত - উত্তরাংশ.pdf/৪৮৪">Srihattar Itibritta: Uttarrangsho</a></i> <bdi lang="bn">শ্রীহট্রের ইতিবৃত্ত: উত্তরাংশ</bdi> (in Bengali). Calcutta: Katha. p. 484 – via <a href="/wiki/Wikisource" title="Wikisource">Wikisource</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Srihattar+Itibritta%3A+Uttarrangsho+%E0%A6%B6%E0%A7%8D%E0%A6%B0%E0%A7%80%E0%A6%B9%E0%A6%9F%E0%A7%8D%E0%A6%B0%E0%A7%87%E0%A6%B0+%E0%A6%87%E0%A6%A4%E0%A6%BF%E0%A6%AC%E0%A7%83%E0%A6%A4%E0%A7%8D%E0%A6%A4%3A+%E0%A6%89%E0%A6%A4%E0%A7%8D%E0%A6%A4%E0%A6%B0%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%82%E0%A6%B6&amp;rft.place=Calcutta&amp;rft.pages=484&amp;rft.pub=Katha&amp;rft.date=1917&amp;rft.aulast=Choudhury&amp;rft.aufirst=Achyut+Charan&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-ray174-82"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-ray174_82-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFRay2011">Ray, Indrajit (2011). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=CHOrAgAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA174" rel="nofollow"><i>Bengal Industries and the British Industrial Revolution (1757–1857)</i></a>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-harrison-83"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-harrison_83-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFLawrence_E._Harrison,_Peter_L._Berger2006"><a href="/wiki/Lawrence_Harrison_(academic)" title="Lawrence Harrison (academic)">Lawrence E. Harrison</a>, <a href="/wiki/Peter_L._Berger" title="Peter L. Berger">Peter L. <li id="cite_note-100"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-100">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFvan_Schendel2009">van Schendel, Willem (2009). <i>A History of Bangladesh</i> (1st ed.). <li id="cite_note-Roy2019-115"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Roy2019_115-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation cs2" id="CITEREFRoy2019">Roy, Tirthankar (2019), <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=XBWZDwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA117" rel="nofollow"><i>How British Rule Changed India's Economy: The Paradox of the Raj</i></a>, Springer, pp. 117–, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-3-030-17708-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-3-030-17708-9"><bdi>978-3-030-17708-9</bdi></a>, <q>The 1769-1770 famine in Bengal followed two years of erratic rainfall worsened by a smallpox epidemic.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=How+British+Rule+Changed+India%27s+Economy%3A+The+Paradox+of+the+Raj&amp;rft.pages=117-&amp;rft.pub=Springer&amp;rft.date=2019&amp;rft.isbn=978-3-030-17708-9&amp;rft.aulast=Roy&amp;rft.aufirst=Tirthankar&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DXBWZDwAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA117&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-116"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-116">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFDatta2000">Datta, Rajat (2000). <a class="external text" href="https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/44927255" rel="nofollow"><i>Society, economy, and the market : commercialization in rural Bengal, c. 1760–1800</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-122"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-122">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFNitish_Sengupta2001"><a href="/wiki/Nitish_Sengupta" title="Nitish Sengupta">Nitish Sengupta</a> (2001). <i>History of the Bengali-speaking People</i>. UBS Publishers' Distributors. p. 211. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-81-7476-355-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-81-7476-355-6"><bdi>978-81-7476-355-6</bdi></a>. <q>The Bengal Renaissance can be said to have started with Raja Ram Mohan Roy (1775-1833) and ended with Rabindranath Tagore (1861-1941), although there were many other stalwarts thereafter embodying particular aspects of the unique intellectual and creative ferment.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=History+of+the+Bengali-speaking+People&amp;rft.pages=211&amp;rft.pub=UBS+Publishers%27+Distributors&amp;rft.date=2001&amp;rft.isbn=978-81-7476-355-6&amp;rft.au=Nitish+Sengupta&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-126"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-126">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.theodora.com/encyclopedia/e/eastern_bengal_and_assam.html" rel="nofollow">"Eastern Bengal and Assam – Encyclopedia"</a>. Theodora.com<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">24 September</span> 2015</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Eastern+Bengal+and+Assam+%E2%80%93+Encyclopedia&amp;rft.pub=Theodora.com&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.theodora.com%2Fencyclopedia%2Fe%2Feastern_bengal_and_assam.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-127"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-127">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation magazine cs1" id="CITEREFKennedy2005">Kennedy, Bernard (December 2005). <a class="external text" href="http://www.diplomat.com.tr/sayilar/s14/yazilar/s14-3.htm" rel="nofollow">"Ambassador Rezaqul Haider: Mediating for commerce"</a>. <i>Diplomat</i>. Ankara, Turkey. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20171010140515/http://www.diplomat.com.tr/sayilar/s14/yazilar/s14-3.htm" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 10 October 2017<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">30 July</span> 2017</span>. <q>After the First World War when the great leader Mustafa Kemal Atatürk started his war of independence, the people of Bengal were very spontaneous in giving all sorts of support. To the extent that there is evidence that the womenfolk donated their own bangles and gold ornaments, and the funds were used for the establishment of a bank, the construction of the parliament building and the purchase of armaments and ammunition to help the war of liberation. As you know, our national poet, Nazrul Islam, was the first foreigner to write an epic poem about Mustafa Kemal.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Diplomat&amp;rft.atitle=Ambassador+Rezaqul+Haider%3A+Mediating+for+commerce&amp;rft.date=2005-12&amp;rft.aulast=Kennedy&amp;rft.aufirst=Bernard&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.diplomat.com.tr%2Fsayilar%2Fs14%2Fyazilar%2Fs14-3.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-128"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-128">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/mar/29/winston-churchill-policies-contributed-to-1943-bengal-famine-study" rel="nofollow">"Churchill's policies contributed to 1943 Bengal famine – study"</a>. <i>The Guardian</i>. 29 March 2019.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Guardian&amp;rft.atitle=Churchill%27s+policies+contributed+to+1943+Bengal+famine+%E2%80%93+study&amp;rft.date=2019-03-29&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theguardian.com%2Fworld%2F2019%2Fmar%2F29%2Fwinston-churchill-policies-contributed-to-1943-bengal-famine-study&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-Saikia2011-131"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Saikia2011_131-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFYasmin_Saikia2011">Yasmin Saikia (2011). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=YdQaz1ddI-wC&amp;pg=PA34" rel="nofollow"><i>Women, War, and the Making of Bangladesh: Remembering 1971</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-LewisSagar1992-133"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-LewisSagar1992_133-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFDavid_S._LewisDarren_J._Sagar1992">David S. Lewis; Darren J. Sagar (1992). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=S4uyAAAAIAAJ" rel="nofollow"><i>Political Parties of Asia and the Pacific: A Reference Guide</i></a>. Longman. p. 36. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-09811-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-582-09811-4"><bdi>978-0-582-09811-4</bdi></a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20180131225046/https://books.google.com/books?id=S4uyAAAAIAAJ" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 31 January 2018<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">30 July</span> 2017</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Political+Parties+of+Asia+and+the+Pacific%3A+A+Reference+Guide&amp;rft.pages=36&amp;rft.pub=Longman&amp;rft.date=1992&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-582-09811-4&amp;rft.au=David+S.+Lewis&amp;rft.au=Darren+J.+Sagar&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DS4uyAAAAIAAJ&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span>"ts present name in December 1953"</span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-149"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-149">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFBass2014">Bass, Gary Jonathan (2014). <i>The Blood Telegram: Nixon, Kissinger, and a Forgotten Genocide</i>. Knopf. p. 50. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-307-70020-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-307-70020-9"><bdi>978-0-307-70020-9</bdi></a>. <q>That night [25 March] ... The Pakistani military had launched a devastating assault on the Bengalis.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Blood+Telegram%3A+Nixon%2C+Kissinger%2C+and+a+Forgotten+Genocide&amp;rft.pages=50&amp;rft.pub=Alfred+A.+Knopf&amp;rft.date=2014&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-307-70020-9&amp;rft.aulast=Bass&amp;rft.aufirst=Gary+Jonathan&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-150"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-150">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFSiegfried_O._WolfJivanta_SchöttliDominik_FrommherzKai_Fürstenberg2014">Siegfried O. Springer. p. 111. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-3-319-09087-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-3-319-09087-0"><bdi>978-3-319-09087-0</bdi></a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20170214215717/https://books.google.com/books?id=BAJNBQAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA111" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 14 February 2017<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-Benvenisti2012-158"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Benvenisti2012_158-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Benvenisti2012_158-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFBenvenisti2012"><a href="/wiki/Eyal_Benvenisti" title="Eyal Benvenisti">Benvenisti, Eyal</a> (2012) [First published 1992]. <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=f19hVb54_s8C&amp;pg=PA190" rel="nofollow"><i>The International Law of Occupation</i></a> (2nd ed.). Oxford University Press. p. 190. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-19-163957-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-19-163957-9"><bdi>978-0-19-163957-9</bdi></a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20170214220204/https://books.google.com/books?id=f19hVb54_s8C&amp;pg=PA190" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 14 February 2017<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">20 January</span> 2017</span>. <q>The genuine and widely recognized claim for Bangladeshi self-determination as an entity independent of West Pakistan, coupled with the repulsion caused by the Pakistani measures to suppress that claim convinced global public opinion ... By the time its admission for membership in the United Nations came before the Security Council, in August 1972, Bangladesh had already been recognized by eighty-six countries.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+International+Law+of+Occupation&amp;rft.pages=190&amp;rft.edition=2nd&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2012&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-19-163957-9&amp;rft.aulast=Benvenisti&amp;rft.aufirst=Eyal&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3Df19hVb54_s8C%26pg%3DPA190&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-laporte-163"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-laporte_163-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFLaPorte1972">LaPorte, R (1972). "Pakistan in 1971: The Disintegration of a Nation". <i>Asian Survey</i>. <b>12</b> (2): 97–108. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.2307%2F2643071" rel="nofollow">10.2307/2643071</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/JSTOR_(identifier)" title="JSTOR (identifier)">JSTOR</a> <a class="external text" href="//www.jstor.org/stable/2643071" rel="nofollow">2643071</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Asian+Survey&amp;rft.atitle=Pakistan+in+1971%3A+The+Disintegration+of+a+Nation&amp;rft.volume=12&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.pages=97-108&amp;rft.date=1972&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.2307%2F2643071&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.jstor.org%2Fstable%2F2643071%23id-name%3DJSTOR&amp;rft.aulast=LaPorte&amp;rft.aufirst=R&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Rummel-8-2-164"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Rummel-8-2_164-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Rummel, Rudolph J. <li id="cite_note-192"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-192">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://203.112.218.65:8008/WebTestApplication/userfiles/Image/PopMonographs/PopulationProjection.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Population Projection of Bangladesh: Dynamics and Trends, 2011–2061"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>Bangladesh Bureau of Statistics</i>. <li id="cite_note-193"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-193">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" Alexis; <a href="/wiki/Eric_Franklin_Wood" title="Eric Franklin Wood">Wood, Eric F.</a> (30 October 2018). <a class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6207062" rel="nofollow">"Present and future Köppen-Geiger climate classification maps at 1-km resolution"</a>. <i>Scientific Data</i>. <b>5</b>: 180214. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bibcode_(identifier)" title="Bibcode (identifier)">Bibcode</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2018NatSD...580214B" rel="nofollow">2018NatSD...580214B</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Scientific+Data&amp;rft.atitle=Present+and+future+K%C3%B6ppen-Geiger+climate+classification+maps+at+1-km+resolution&amp;rft.volume=5&amp;rft.pages=180214&amp;rft.date=2018-10-30&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC6207062%23id-name%3DPMC&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F30375988&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1038%2Fsdata.2018.214&amp;rft_id=info%3Abibcode%2F2018NatSD...580214B&amp;rft.aulast=Beck&amp;rft.aufirst=Hylke+E.&amp;rft.au=Zimmermann%2C+Niklaus+E.&amp;rft.au=McVicar%2C+Tim+R.&amp;rft.au=Vergopolan%2C+Noemi&amp;rft.au=Berg%2C+Alexis&amp;rft.au=Wood%2C+Eric+F.&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC6207062&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-194"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-194">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110713134542/http://kantaji.com/dinajpurmap.html" rel="nofollow">"Map of Dinajpur"</a>. <i>kantaji.com</i>. <li id="cite_note-223"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-223">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://press-files.anu.edu.au/downloads/press/p33231/mobile/ch07.html" rel="nofollow">"The Military and Democracy in Bangladesh"</a>. <i>press-files.anu.edu.au</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-239"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-239">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFRahmanMoazzemChowdhurySehrin2014">Rahman, Mustafizur; Moazzem, Khondaker Golam; Chowdhury, Mehruna Islam; Sehrin, Farzana (September 2014). <a class="external text" href="https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/publication/156355/adbi-wp500.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Connecting South Asia and Southeast Asia: A Bangladesh Country Study"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <a href="/wiki/Asian_Development_Bank" title="Asian Development Bank">Asian Development Bank</a>. <a class="external text" href="https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20221009/https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/publication/156355/adbi-wp500.pdf" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 9 October 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-294"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-294">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

</li>

<li id="cite_note-311"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-311">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFAhaduzzamanSarkarAnjumKhan2017">Ahaduzzaman; Sarkar, Prottasha; Anjum, Aniqa; Khan, Easir A. <li id="cite_note-rashiduzzaman-350"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-rashiduzzaman_350-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFRashiduzzaman1998">Rashiduzzaman, M (1998). <li id="cite_note-kbrs-365"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-kbrs_365-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-kbrs_365-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://bangladesh.gov.bd/site/page/812d94a8-0376-4579-a8f1-a1f66fa5df5d/Know--Bangladesh" rel="nofollow">"Know Bangladesh"</a>. <i>Government of Bangladesh</i>. Government of Bangladesh. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20181009183830/http://www.bangladesh.gov.bd/site/page/812d94a8-0376-4579-a8f1-a1f66fa5df5d/Know--Bangladesh" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 9 October 2018<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite_note-366"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-366">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://features.pewforum.org/muslim-population/?sort=Pop2010" rel="nofollow">"Muslim Population by Country"</a>. <li id="cite_note-overview-378"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-overview_378-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-overview_378-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-overview_378-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFAhmedAlamAnwarBegum2015">Ahmed, Syed Masud; Alam, Bushra Binte; Anwar, Iqbal; Begum, Tahmina; Huque, Rumana; AM Khan, Jahangir; Nababan, Herfina; Osman, Ferdaus Arfina (2015). <li id="cite_note-379"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-379">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.newagebd.net/article/11610/onelink.to/articlelist/323/Cartoon" rel="nofollow">"Health Ministry split into 2 divisions"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/New_Age_(Bangladesh)" title="New Age (Bangladesh)">New Age</a></i>. 20 March 2017<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">1 October</span> 2022</span>. <q>The government has now split the Health and Family Welfare Ministry into two divisions. The new divisions under the ministry are — Health Services Division, and Medical Education and Family Welfare Division.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=New+Age&amp;rft.atitle=Health+Ministry+split+into+2+divisions&amp;rft.date=2017-03-20&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newagebd.net%2Farticle%2F11610%2Fonelink.to%2Farticlelist%2F323%2FCartoon&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-380"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-380">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFAhmedHossainChowdhuryBhuiya2011">Ahmed, Syed Masud; Hossain, Md Awlad; Chowdhury, Ahmed Mushtaque Raja; Bhuiya, Abbas Uddin (22 January 2011). <a class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3037300" rel="nofollow">"The health workforce crisis in Bangladesh: shortage, inappropriate skill-mix and inequitable distribution"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Human_Resources_for_Health" title="Human Resources for Health">Human Resources for Health</a></i>. <a href="/wiki/BioMed_Central" title="BioMed Central">BioMed Central</a>. <b>9</b> (3): 3. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1186%2F1478-4491-9-3" rel="nofollow">10.1186/1478-4491-9-3</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMC_(identifier)" title="PMC (identifier)">PMC</a> <span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3037300" rel="nofollow">3037300</a></span>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a> <a class="external text" href="//pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/21255446" rel="nofollow">21255446</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Human+Resources+for+Health&amp;rft.atitle=The+health+workforce+crisis+in+Bangladesh%3A+shortage%2C+inappropriate+skill-mix+and+inequitable+distribution&amp;rft.volume=9&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.pages=3&amp;rft.date=2011-01-22&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC3037300%23id-name%3DPMC&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F21255446&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1186%2F1478-4491-9-3&amp;rft.aulast=Ahmed&amp;rft.aufirst=Syed+Masud&amp;rft.au=Hossain%2C+Md+Awlad&amp;rft.au=Chowdhury%2C+Ahmed+Mushtaque+Raja&amp;rft.au=Bhuiya%2C+Abbas+Uddin&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC3037300&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-395"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-395">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFAndaleebSiddiquiKhandakar2007">Andaleeb, Syed Saad; Siddiqui, Nazlee; Khandakar, Shahjahan (July 2007). "Patient satisfaction with health services in Bangladesh". <i><a href="/wiki/Health_Policy_and_Planning" title="Health Policy and Planning">Health Policy and Planning</a></i>. <a href="/wiki/Oxford_University_Press" title="Oxford University Press">Oxford University Press</a>. <b>22</b> (4): 263–273. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1093%2Fheapol%2Fczm017" rel="nofollow">10.1093/heapol/czm017</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a> <a class="external text" href="//pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17545252" rel="nofollow">17545252</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Health+Policy+and+Planning&amp;rft.atitle=Patient+satisfaction+with+health+services+in+Bangladesh&amp;rft.volume=22&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.pages=263-273&amp;rft.date=2007-07&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1093%2Fheapol%2Fczm017&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F17545252&amp;rft.aulast=Andaleeb&amp;rft.aufirst=Syed+Saad&amp;rft.au=Siddiqui%2C+Nazlee&amp;rft.au=Khandakar%2C+Shahjahan&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABangladesh"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-443"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-443">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://bdnews24.com/bangladesh/2015/12/22/swadhin-bangla-betar-kendras-rashidul-hossain-passes-away" rel="nofollow">"Swadhin Bangla Betar Kendra's Rashidul Hossain passes away"</a>. <i>bdnews24.com</i>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20151229065132/http://bdnews24.com/bangladesh/2015/12/22/swadhin-bangla-betar-kendras-rashidul-hossain-passes-away" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 29 December 2015<span class="reference-accessdate">. </div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3"><div><div class="hlist hlist-separated"><ul><li><sup>1</sup> Spans the conventional boundary between Europe and another continent.</li><li><sup>2</sup> Considered European for cultural, political and historical reasons but is geographically in Western Asia.</li></ul></div>
<ul><li><img alt="" class="noviewer" data-file-height="185" data-file-width="180" decoding="async" height="16" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/96/Symbol_category_class.svg/16px-Symbol_category_class.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/96/Symbol_category_class.svg/23px-Symbol_category_class.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/96/Symbol_category_class.svg/31px-Symbol_category_class.svg.png 2x" title="Category" width="16"/> <b><a href="/wiki/Category:Asia" title="Category:Asia">Category</a></b></li>
<li><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Symbol_portal_class.svg" title="Portal"><img alt="" class="noviewer" data-file-height="185" data-file-width="180" decoding="async" height="16" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e2/Symbol_portal_class.svg/16px-Symbol_portal_class.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e2/Symbol_portal_class.svg/23px-Symbol_portal_class.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e2/Symbol_portal_class.svg/31px-Symbol_portal_class.svg.png 2x" width="16"/></a> <b><a href="/wiki/Portal:Asia" title="Portal:Asia">Asia portal</a></b></li></ul></div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Organisation_of_Islamic_Cooperation_(OIC)" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks hlist mw-collapsible mw-collapsed navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Organisation_of_Islamic_Cooperation" title="Template:Organisation of Islamic Cooperation"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Organisation_of_Islamic_Cooperation" title="Template talk:Organisation of Islamic Cooperation"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Organisation_of_Islamic_Cooperation&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Organisation_of_Islamic_Cooperation_(OIC)" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/Organisation_of_Islamic_Cooperation" title="Organisation of Islamic Cooperation">Organisation of Islamic Cooperation</a> (OIC)</div></th></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Members</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Afghanistan" title="Afghanistan">Afghanistan</a></li>
